alert.note: Alert for Gloucester; James City; Newport News; York (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:43PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Gloucester, York, and James City Counties, the north central City of Newport News and the City of Williamsburg through 530 PM EDT... At 442 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Jamestown, or near College Of William And Mary, moving east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Newport News, Williamsburg, Gloucester Courthouse, College Of William And Mary, Queens Lake, Virginia Institute For Marine Sciences, Seaford, Gloucester Point, Norge, Busch Gardens, Hayes, Wicomico, Achilles, York Terrace, Lee Hall, Carver Gardens, Grove, Kings Point, Jamestown and Scotland. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for eastern, southeastern and east central Virginia.

area.areaDesc: Gloucester; James City; Newport News; York
